description.en:
It is possible to get maximum 2.5 points for homework. Length: in case the work has 2 authors, at least 10 pages of main text in Times New Roman 12 (single-spaced), paper A4, edges from everywhere 2.54 cm. Also look at the Homework template file!

NB! The title page, figures, tables (if you wish to add any of these) and the list of references are not considered as parts of the main text!

NB! In case there is only 1 author (but we expect most of you to write together with someone), then you should write 5 pages, and in case of 3 authors, you should write 15 pages (following the same rules about title page, tables, edges etc.)

Citations: the study should cite at least 10 different sources (in case of writing 10 pages; if the work has only 1 author, then you’ll need at least 5 sources while in case of 3 authors, you’ll need at least 15) and you should also express your own opinion(s). Your own opinion should be clearly distinguished from the rest of the text (e.g. based on the above discussion, we propose that…).

You will lose 0.1 points for every day you are late. E.g. if you submit it 8 days after the deadline, you will lose 0.8 points.

Also, you will lose points if the work is too short (e.g. if the main text is only 6 pages instead of 10, you will lose 40%= 1 point).

It is possible to get maximum 1.0 points for presenting the homework.

Its length could be about 7-8 minutes per person (meaning about 15-16 minutes if you do it with 1 co-author); for both video and classroom presentation, the length should be around the same (but in classroom, you might also have to answer a few questions after your 7-8- minute presentation).  

What to do to get 1 point? Submit it on time or before the deadline (also if you present it in the classroom), do not make it too short or too long and do not read everything word-to-word: use your own words and show some "energy" and enthusiasm for your topic! NB! If your presentation is late, you will also lose 0.1 points per each day you are late.

The “exam” (questions about lectures) will give maximum 7 points. Each of the 7 questions will give 1 point if you pass it (if you do not pass or do not submit your answer on time, you will get 0 points). There will be 1 question per every lecture and each question will be evaluated only by the person who taught that lecture.

The questions will be “essay-type” (0.5-1 page each, Times New Roman 12 pt. single-spaced). You do not have to comment or draw any figures. 

NB! You can use all materials during the “exam” (e.g. lecture slides, textbooks, journal articles, statistics etc.) but you have to cite them properly! Of course, you should also express your own opinion, but you should express that clearly (e.g. I think that….).

NB! Each student has to do the “exam” alone! Co-authorship or “shadow authorship” is not allowed!

arvestatud.en: getting 6 or more points for the course (out of 10.5)

mittearvestatud.en: getting less than 6 points for the course (but more than 0)

mitteilmunud.en: getting 0 points for the course (not doing anything)
